description.narrative: (1) Support the Development of SMEs. The Fund is expected to invest in small and medium-sized enterprises in the Target Countries. The Fund will address a major constraint faced by SMEs by providing access to finance through equity and quasi-equity instruments. In addition to its capital investment, the Manager expects to provide hands-on support to strengthen the management capacity, develop new information systems, improve accounting and financial systems, and play an active role in identifying new market opportunities and potential acquisition targets. (2) IDA countries. The Fund intends to invest in SMEs located in IDA countries such as Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam. (3) Promote Private Sector Development and Create Jobs. The Manager is expected to source quality SMEs that can generate employment and accelerate growth enabling them to become local and regional market leaders. Furthermore, the successful execution of the Manager''s strategy will attract additional funding sources from the private sector to help narrow the funding gap experienced by most SMEs.

Aureos South-East Asia Fund II (the Fund or the Company) is a closed-end private equity fund which will make equity and quasi-equity investments in a balanced and diversified portfolio of small to medium-sized enterprises located in South-East Asia (Aureos SEAsia II or the Project). The Fund intends to make investments in Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos, collectively the Target Countries.

participating-org.narrative: AUREOS SOUTH-EAST ASIA FUND II LP

mailing-address.narrative: Brigit van Dijk - van de Reijt Partner, Aureos Singapore Managers Pte Limited HYPERLINK " mailto:Brigit@aureos.com "Brigit@aureos.com

name.narrative: Aureos South-East Asia Fund II LP will be a limited partnership formed under the laws of the Province of Ontario, Canada. The Funds Investment Team will be based in five of the Target Countries (Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia, Malaysia and Vietnam) and will be led by a Jakarta-based Managing Partner.
